intro: Mollia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender mollia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks. Mollia tenuifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where the climate supports its growth.
